intro: Apodocephala oliganthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, and it thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
